meanings.definition: Lack of moral principles; dishonorable behavior.
meanings.sent1: His baseness was evident in his deceitful actions.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's baseness was revealed in court.
meanings.sent3: Despite his baseness, he tried to act innocent.
meanings.sent4: The baseness of his character was like a dark cloud over him.
meanings.sent5: The baseness of his betrayal left a lasting impact.

meanings.definition: The quality of being low in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: Her baseness in the company hierarchy was clear to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's baseness prevented him from advancing in rank.
meanings.sent3: His baseness in the team made him the underdog.
meanings.sent4: The baseness of the servant's role was humbling.
meanings.sent5: The baseness of his job made him feel unimportant.

meanings.definition: The state of being of low quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The baseness of the product was disappointing to customers.
meanings.sent2: The artist refused to compromise on the baseness of his work.
meanings.sent3: The baseness of the material used made the sculpture fragile.
meanings.sent4: The baseness of the painting reflected the artist's lack of skill.
meanings.sent5: The baseness of the fabric was evident in its rough texture.
